title: Twin.Peaks.DGE.S02E19-S02E22.FWWM.DVDRip.x264.AAC.5.1.iNT-PDS (5
description:
Parts:  Season 2 Episode 19-22 (intros are included) , The Movie: Fire Walk With Me
Source: Definitive Gold Edition (huge thanks to torolo), the Spanish and Nordic version of the movie (thanks to jlksw & allthetime)
Audio:  English , AAC 5.1
Subs:   English, Danish, German, Spanish, Italian, Dutch, Norwegian, Finnish, Swedish, Hungarian (in separate srt files)

From an nfo file:

--------------------- Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me (1992) -----------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Supplier......: jlksw & allthetime    +Video Codec..: x264 r709 , 2pass       
Release date..: 2008.02.12         +  +Total Bitrate: 1814 kbps               
File size.....: 1.87 GB (~3/7 DVD5)   +Main Video...: ~1852 kbps     +        
Source video..: PAL DVD9 WS 1.85:1    +Credits......: ~907 kbps (50%)         
Source audio..: AC3 5.1 448kbps 48KHz +Resolution...: 720*544                 
Audio Language: English               +Anamorphic...: Yes, SAR:1024/720       
Subtitle......: EN,DA,NL,FI,DE,IT,NO  +Display dims.: 1024*544            +   
..............: ES,SV,HU              +Colorimetry..: BT.601              +   
Chapters......: Yes                   +TV system....: PAL , 25 fps            
Movie lenght..: 2:09:17    +          +Audio Codec..: Nero AAC LC 5.1 48 KHz  
Comp. check...: None                  +Audio Bitrate: ABR 255 kbps (no DRC) 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  The video and audio stream comes from the Spanish edition, as well as the
spanish subs, the other subs (except for the HU) and the chapter infos     
comes from the Nordic edition (picture and sound quality were the same).   
Sometimes, there&#039;s a 2nd sub for a language (EN2,DE2,IT2,ES2), which meant 
for the corresponding audio dub. For the sake of completeness, we included 
them too.                                                                  

  We don&#039;t follow the scene rules, regarding to the release sizes. Firstly,
nowdays the current storage medium is DVD5 and not CD. Secondly, why would 
we wasting space if we get the same quality at non-standard sizes.         
  So after a couple of test we end up with 630 MB for a 45 min episode,    
which is ~1/7 DVD5. That means that the whole 2 season and the movie will  
fit in 5 DVD5. Look at the quants below, and you will see, that it&#039;s almost
transparent encoding, which means that it&#039;s almost identical to the        
original DVD.                                                              
                               +                                           
  PS: Don&#039;t forget to set "Set pixel aspect ratio in output media type" at 
the Output section in ffdshow video decoder configuration to get the       
correct aspect ratio. And if you want to use your standalone audio receiver
with these non-AC3 and non-DTS releases through S/PDIF, you must set       
"AC3 (S/PDIF encode mode)" at the Output section in ffdshow audio decoder  
configuration, since - currently - AAC and 5.1 channel PCM can&#039;t be passed 
through S/PDIF (maybe the next generation soundcards will support this     
feature through the HDMI interface).                                       
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
